modules.description: This module defines core types and operations for managing Off-the-Record session states, including encryption status checks, session initialization with DSA keys, and configuration updates. It operates on session records, security policies, protocol versions, and cryptographic keys, enabling secure messaging workflows with forward secrecy and version-specific policy enforcement. Serialization utilities

This module processes OTR session messages, handling encryption, decryption, and state transitions during communication. It works with `session` data structures to manage conversation state, including initiating and terminating sessions, responding to handshake messages, and handling SMP challenges. Concrete operations include starting an OTR session, sending and ending messages, handling incoming data, and managing SMP authentication with zero-knowledge proofs based on user-provided secrets.

This module formats and computes OTR fingerprints as defined in the protocol specification. It works with DSA keys and session state to produce SHA1-based fingerprints. Their fingerprint is derived from an established session, while own fingerprint is computed directly from a private DSA key.

This module implements the Off-the-Record cryptographic protocol for secure instant messaging, supporting protocol versions 2 and 3. It provides functions for session initialization, message encryption and decryption, Diffie-Hellman key exchange, and SMP-based authentication using zero-knowledge proofs. The module works with DSA keys, session state records, and protocol messages to enable private, authenticated communication with forward secrecy.
